title: I can’t believe these are sold by Apple
text:
I purchased a OMNA Camera over a month ago to supplement my current nest cams and to be my first foray into HomeKit cameras, lets just say they’re not off to a good start. The recent software update did bring improvements such as the day review and automatic updates, but the camera’s are still buggy.

I inherited 2 more cameras from a friend recently and I found that all 3 of these cameras all use the same network name leading to some difficulties setting up. Also I found when viewing both from the app then switching immediately over to the integrated home app, one of the Cramer’s crashes every time requiring a hard power reset. The app isn’t bad getting around in but it takes WAY too many clicks on the GUI to get to any recordings from the cameras: see Nest or even the super smooth interface from Apples own Time Machine on MacOSX!

Another big hit is the inability to provide notifications only when you are not at home. Sure the new app has a button to press for away, but this all needs to be automated: also see Nest.

I hope the updates to both the firmware for the cameras and features for the apps continue to be released by D-link, as well as HomeKit capability improvements from Apple. I feel like it’s a solid product but needs support!

title: Features need polishing
text: I love the camera, it works great in the home app and also in OMNA app for viewing. However features in this Omna app need polishing, specifically the recorded playback features. The daily recap feature is awesome, but only after the 10+ minutes it take for it to put itself together and finally play for me. There needs to be an option for these daily recaps to automatically create themselves everyday and save itself to the micro SD card. That way we can just stream it instead of rendering it every time we tap the thumbnail for that day. I just used it, and after watching I went back to the screen to choose a day, went back to the same day I just did, and then it started the long process again.... why? Just fix that and this will be an amazing feature. Also I run into a bug where it says only two people can be viewing at the same time something like that, but literally no one is viewing it only me. And I know because I’ve tested it with the people who have access to it.

title: Need better motion detection method
text: The current motion detection at night when using night view is a disaster. I choose detection areas and sensitivity level, and it even detect when a bug or visible dust fly by the camera and record lots of random clips with no use. All I need to to detect person or other objects! Need an update with better machine learning and adaption. And a better way to view all my random bug or dust clips in the app. Scrolling through hundreds of useless clips just to find one useful clip at the last is a waste of time. Please fix these problems. Thank you.

title: Good at recording but not at looking at what was recorded.
text: An item was stolen outside from right in front of the camera. But the time period was a week long. The stolen item is valuable but not valuable enough compared to the time requires to look through the hundreds or thousands of little snippets of video. It would help if the video thumbnails were bigger so a thumbnail might show a detail of what triggered the motion recording. Ability to download all or plug the micro SD card into a computer would be great, (My macs wont recognize card format) Then I could scrub through the videos so much faster in an app actually designed for video playback. Trying to download video after video in the app is just as slow as trying to open the videos to scrub through them.

title: Needs an on demand record button
text: It seems like this camera just records at random...my kids are running around all day and it says no clips, then randomly one day I get a bunch of clips... great camera for live and 2 way... terrible at recording... it would be great to have a button to record so if someone breaks in you get the motion alert and you can hit record. Or fix how it records/ have clips longer than 30sec. Also option to delete oldest recording first if you run out of space instead of having to format the card.

title: Camera is great, app is horrendous.
text: The camera quality when watching LIVE is superb. Crystal clear with almost no latency. However, the app itself is a buggy mess. Reviewing your footage takes FOREVER and there’s no reason for it. When trying to upgrade the firmware I am told I am not on the same WiFi network over and over again.

title: New update very welcome
text: Finally! New version 1.0.7 of the app—and firmware 1.4–resolve all the problems, and add back the promised new features, so at last they work as advertised. After the first disastrous release and subsequent withdrawal of this version, I wasn’t sure if D-Link’s programmers would ever get their act together, but they did. Took them long enough, but in the end they’ve done right by us.

title: Thankful for most features
text:
The camera does a great job of recording all the events of motion that take place. Easy way to see past events and play them no matter if I’m at home, vacation, or work. Most of all it’s Apple HomeKit enabled. 
One request I have is for a mass delete option when I’m viewing all the videos, for there are many days when I’m home and I just want to delete all the recorded videos from that day.

title: Confusing and feature poor app

The app is confusing to use, settings seem all over the place, hard to find things such as recordings. There are no menu items for such things as hot spots; maybe there is though as I had said previously, the app is difficult to use. In fact ya would think that the app was designed by hardware engineers and not user interface experts, maybe the same guy that did the clock interface on an early VCR.

The camera itself seems okay, maybe better than others.

title: Doesn't record continuously, 20 sec clips
text:
Really could be a great camera for use with HomeKit. Easy setup simple menus. 

Biggest miss is the 20sec record from a motion detection. If your looking to have a continuous feed for review, forget it. It's annoying that you can't set a recording length longer or until movement stops. You end up with a bunch of 20 sec clips and missing footage while it retriggers in between recordings. The retrigger has nothing to do with length of recording it just senses motion and records again at max 20seconds. 

Update this feature D-Link! Your other cameras have it!

title: Easy, But Missing Features
text:
Setup of the new camera was wonderful simple. The interface is nonstandard, but not hard to figure out. One key feature that should have been obvious, but is unfortunately missing, is some kind of zoom feature. You get this great big wide angle view of your room in a nice high quality image, but you can't actually see anything that isn't right in front of the camera because of that wide angle. This is particularly exacerbated on small screens like on the phone versus an iPad. Also, I find myself missing a manual control over night/day mode. This was available in the old D-Link camera app and was useful when the automatic control got it wrong.

I realize this is a new product with new software, so I'm hoping these little issues will be corrected quickly in subsequent updates.

title: Needs a way to store video in the cloud
text:
I absolutely love that this app supports HomeKit. In fact, that's why I chose this camera over my older Nest cam. However, there is one glaring omission that means I won't be able to use this camera as my main one anytime soon...

The one major thing this device needs is the ability to save video (say 24 hours worth) in the cloud for safekeeping. I appreciate the fact that the Omna camera gives you the ability to use a microSD card for more long term storage, which is something that I always wanted with my Nest cam, but what good is that if your home gets broken into and the camera is stolen? Cloud storage is a necessary companion to internal storage and without it this device isn't a full fledged security camera. 

I really hope the ability to integrate recordings with iCloud is added very soon. I'd definitely pick up more of these cameras if it is.

title: Missing key features
text: While the picture is good in the app, there are some key features missing that make this version less than optimal. Namely the ability to zoom as well as the monitor not overriding your phones auto shutoff feature, which means you have to keep opening the app up and waiting for it to load the camera view. Not great if you're trying to keep tabs on a sleeping baby.

title: Good start ...
text:
Although a good start the camera really needs homekit based recording control. In other words, you need to be able to create a scene such as "leaving" or "home" which can turn motion recording on/off. Currently the only attributes that can be controlled via homekit are speaker audio,  mic audio, and image mirroring.

I like the product but i want to control it via location services which is currently not possible. 

This may be a current homekit limitation but i very much doubt it.

title: OK for v1.0
text:
Nice camera but waiting for a few more things. I'd give it more stars but the v1.0 feature set brings the score down a bit. 

I haven't yet found a way to integrate this with my Apple Watch tho that is featured in the video. A watch app is needed. 

No clear solution for notifications. I'd like an email or a notice sent to my iOS device, again as featured in the video, but it beats me how to set this up. Second day research continues. 

Would like a sensitivity setting for switching to night black and white mode. Seems to want lots of light to show color and darker rooms are often in b/w even during the day. 

Seems to me the most recent recordings should appear at the top of the SD card video file list. Or give us a sort option. Me, I'd rather see what just happened instead of the oldest content in storage. 

Desperately need the option to save a video to our Photos app. And yes, automatically to iCloud as well. The point made by another reviewer that a stolen camera makes a security camera worthless is dead on. 

Sound doesn't seem quite right yet. The camera speaker seems to play the sound the unit broadcasts as well as the sound from the distant app user. Duplex please. 

Security, vis a vis The Internet of Thingys. Please explain what you've done to prevent our cameras from being hacked. 

Motion recording smarts are needed. Yes, the suggestion that we be able to automatically disable certain cameras when the owner is home is a great idea. I don't want to have to dress up when I walk around the house at night. Or at least a very direct way to toggle on/off without diving into settings. Consider "Off for X hours" as a bonus. 

Documentation is non-existent. No. A quick start guide does not count as documentation. Maybe documentation would tell me how to do what I think is lacking. The FAQs on their site don't. 

A support link should go to this devices site info, not drop you into the general home page for support. 

FYI, for those who want to quickly delete all their video, just reformat the SD card - app will let you do that. All or nothing tho. 

Kudos for making a nice device that doesn't require an account to use. Just leverage what our devices can do and you have a great solution.

title: Do NOT run 2018-02-28 Update
text: App has always been a bit buggy, especially for installing new camera. But it worked. However, latest update killed remote viewing, when you’re not at the same location as the camera, which is the whole point of a web security camera. I spent a long time working with D-Link support trying to fix this. They were able to replicate the problem and confirm that the upgrade killed remote viewing, but the only solution they could offer was to do an on-site physical reset and reinstallation. Hard to do when the camera is in a remote location. Means that I’ve lost use of the security camera until I can fly to where it’s installed. Inexcusably bad engineering. I’m running the app on a new (less than one year old) iOS device with latest version of OS, so it’s not like I’m running an old legacy configuration that D-Link couldn’t expect to test and support. How could D-Link release an upgrade that kills key camera functionality? Poor testing.

title: Not bad... A few software suggestions...
text:
So far I really like the camera. Easiest setup of a product I have ever experienced. It was literally as easy as plugging in the device and scanning the code on the back with your phones HomeKit camera instructions. Within a few minutes it was up and running. 

Just a few suggestions... 
- Really needs a delete all or delete multiple function when viewing recordings from the day. Sometimes there is just way too many clips to browse through that aren’t necessary and deleting each one by one is annoying. 
- Need a way to either turn the camera off when I arrive home or turn off the motion sensor when I’m home. There is absolutely no reason to have this thing constantly saving video clips of me walking around my home. That’s just stupid and a waste of memory. 
- I wanted the motion sensor to turn on my Hue Lights when it senses motion. Worked great. However when I go to turn the lights off... the motion of the lights turning off sets off the motion sensor which turns the lights right back on again!!! It’s a never ending loop. Had to disable this automation for the time being. Please add a delay so that my lights turning off doesn't re-trigger the automation of turning them back on!!!! 
- Finally... how about a way to store some clips in the cloud? What good does this camera do for me if a robber steals the camera. I will have no way of retrieving the important footage needed to show police if the robber takes the camera with the SD card inside it.
